thread.title: Beer makes it as a Gallery Night & Day stop
thread.title_full: Beer makes it as a Gallery Night & Day stop

title: Beer makes it as a Gallery Night & Day stop
text:
It's the season of the pumpkin and you have two choices. You can blame Starbucks for starting so early that you're on the verge of pumpkin fatigue. 
Or you can make like the Milwaukee Public Market and go with it. 
As part of its 10th anniversary celebration, the market will honor all things pumpkin from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday. That includes tapping a giant pumpkin filled with Lakefront Pumpkin lager. 
What goes with pumpkin beer? Pumpkin bowling. Also pingpong. And hayrides — in the city. 
Admission is free. 
Oct. 16: Brass Tap, 7808 W. Layton Ave., Greenfield, devotes 12 tap lines to pumpkin beers beginning at 5 p.m. The list of brews is on the Brass Tap Facebook page. 
Oct. 16: Add a stop at the Milwaukee County Historical Society on the Gallery Night & Day schedule. The Historical Society, 910 N. Old World 3rd St., presents a series of murals depicting brewing history by artists Jean Allen. The paintings were originally unveiled at the Master Brewers Association of America convention in 1935. The exhibit is open from 5 to 9 p.m. Oct. 16 and 9:30 a.m. to 2 p.m. Oct. 17. 
Oct. 19: Jeff Alworth, author of "The Beer Bible," bellies up to the bar at Sugar Maple, 441 E. Lincoln Ave., for a talk on beers of the world at 7 p.m. He'll hang around for questions and answers. See the Sugar Maple event page on Facebook. 
Oct. 20: BKC, 5100 W. Blue Mound Road, hosts a Pumpkin Beer Party, which is what it sounds like, from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. You can see when BKC hits pumpkin peak at the Facebook page. 
Oct. 20: Draft & Vessel, 4471 N. Oakland Ave., Shorewood, taps a year-old keg of Founders Backwoods Bastard and pours Oatmeal Stout on Nitro and Spectra Trifecta, which was released only in the Midwest. The party starts at 6 p.m., according to the D&V Facebook page. 
Oct. 20: Wild Ales Bierklasse with Barley's Angels at Cafe Centraal, 2306 S. Kinnickinnic Ave., begins at 7 p.m. The price is $30 for beer and snacks. See the Bierklasse page at Facebook. 
Oct. 22: The occasion is the ceremonial opening of the Lakefront Brewery Bublr station at 4 p.m., followed by Bublr Happy Hour at Lakefront Brewing, 1872 N. Commerce St. Ride a Bublr Bike to Lakefront for a free Lakefront beer. See who else going at the event Facebook page. 
Oct. 23: Brews 'N' Ciders, Critters 'N' Spiders is a fitting theme for the benefit for the Humane Animal Welfare Society. The party runs from 6 to 10 p.m. at the Marriott West, W231-N1600 Corporate Court, Waukesha. Come in costume. Tickets are $50. 
Oct. 25: Draft & Vessel, 4471 N. Oakland Ave., hosts a Family Fun Day starting at noon. They'll pour New Holland brews Ichabod, Full Circle, and Dragon's Milk; host pumpkin carving, apple bobbing and a costume contest. Artist Kyle Bice will make paintings with beer. Yup, beer. 
Oct. 30: It's all treat, no trick. Stubby's Gastrogrub & Beer Bar, 2060 N. Humboldt Ave., serves five variations of Dragon's Milk: year-round Dragon's Milk and the 11% ABV beers Triple Mashed, Coffee and Chocolate, Raspberry and Toasted Chilies starting at 5 p.m. 
Nov. 27: It's become a Black Friday tradition. Stand in line for the annual barrel-aged Black Friday release beer. at Lakefront Brewing, 1872 N. Commerce St. The party begins at 6 a.m. See the Black Friday Facebook page. 
Nov. 27: Stubby's introduces its own special release day for Black Friday. The gastrogrub and beer bar introduces Black Friday Brunch with a Bourbon County Stout release from Goose Island. 
For a guide to beer gardens, beer news and more, check out Tap Milwaukee's Beer Here page: jsonline.com/beer. 
Email: kflanigan@journalsentinel.com © 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved. About Kathy Flanigan 
Tap Milwaukee reporter Kathy Flanigan covers entertainment news, events and our beer culture. She is the author of Weekend Guide, a newsletter with best bets for weekend activities.
